TopicTitle: [PARTS] P.E.S.T. - Probe Expansion and Science Things

Articles.Content:
Hello everyone! I wanted to share the development of a new mod I've been working on sporadically for the past month or so.

When I first started playing the game a few months ago, I almost exclusively flew unmanned probes. For me, a big part of the game is about flying to different planets and soaking up all the science (I often create little "profiles" of the planets, including theorizing make-up and formation) and I wanted to create some parts for probes that may add to that experience.

No download link yet, as I'm about to skitter off to work, but I was hoping I could get some feedback on this idea and/or tips or comments. Originally I wanted this pack to be more expansive but I'm a little lost when it comes to adding emissives and animations to parts.

So far, I have four parts.

Coiled Antenna

A stackable part (topmost in the picture) styled after the Venera landers' antennas. High output, low energy consumption.

Double-Sided Sphere Core

Same as the stock sphere core but tweaked so that parts can attach and stack to top and bottom.

Gas Chromatograph

Loosely based on the instrument design on the Huygens lander. Added a science module for it, so it reveals what I theorized the atmosphere compounds are for different planets.

Shock Absorber

Based on the Venera Lander shock abosorber, this piece unfortunately doesn't save your craft from hard landings. (I couldn't figure out the coding - I wanted it to raise the crash tolerance of the entire craft it's placed on, i.e. if the probe lands on the shock absorber at 90m/s, the craft DOESN'T explode.) However it weighs quite a bit and creates drag, which helps to ensure that your craft lands right-side-up and slows descent most of the time, which is also helpful.

So what do you guys think?

Aborted/postponed parts:

Mass Spectrometer

A Mass Spec that grabs a surface sample and tells you the chemical compounds. (Would require animation)

Radially Mounted Ion Engine

A small, radial version of an ion engine. (Would require animation/emissive)

Thanks for looking!

Another thing could maybe have the probe core contain fuel of some kind so you could strap little rockets to it (maybe a large reserve of monoprop) to help control its speedy decent thru the atmosphere/to the planet, because, no-one wants an uncontrolled rocket rushing twords the ground without being able to control it in any way!

One last thing: A camera. I know, I know, their over done, but hear me out. There would be 3 cameras. the 1st would be unlocked in the first science tier, "a simple black and white camera someone decided to stick onto the ship with ducktape. The wires that make it work shock the scientists whenever they touch them." Would provide very little science, but has full transmit data (because it'll go on a probe, and those are hard to get back IMO). The second would but a full color camera, unlocked in the Electronics tier, "After the scientists complained about the first camera zapping them, the engineers came up a camera that directly attaches and uses some new fancy technology called 'Klu Tooth' to link up to the probe to send pictures. With the upgrade came better pictures to! Now with Tekno Kolor!" would have slightly better science value, same full data return. Lastly, a full spectrum camera, unlocked in the probe science/core tab, "When the scientists complained to the engineers that their new camera interfiered with their selfies and pictures of the probe when they were building it, the two teams came together to develop a special camera that only required one wire to send data to and from the probe and the camera. Without the bulky Klu Tooth device haphazardly stuck into the camera, the teams were able to upgrade it once more, giving it a thermal option, UV option, and a higher resolution standard camera. The scientists talk with the engineers about upgrading it further, but the engineers say their tierd and have done their work requirements for the year." Would give 10 science even from the launch pad (for scale so you know what to give other planets and such) and has 90% science return. a little flavor text that could be added to the part would be: "But because of the high resolution, the camera can't send back all its data, at least with the current battery technology." The camera Mits would be (based on from the launch pad) as follows: 10 Mits for BW cam, 50 Mits for Kolor cam, 150 Mits for Full spectrum.

I may add a resource to the probe core so it contains some Monopropellant.

Small update, still tweaking this. Some ideas have been dropped.

In celebration of NASA's DAWN spacecraft reaching Ceres orbit later this week, I've made a probe core and new science part. The probe core is hollow inside (like my lander fuel tanks) to allow resources inside. It also carries a charge of 200 units and 20 units of monopropellant.

The science part is a GRaND (Gamma Ray and Neutron Detector) based on Dawn's unit of the same name. This device analyzes the reflection of cosmic rays from the surface of a body and can determine the elemental composition of the surface based on those cosmic rays. It also detects hydrogen traces, which can be used to estimate the presence of water or water ice.
